title: Modeling the Multivariate Relationship with Contextualized Representations for Effective Human-Object Interaction Detection
summary: This paper introduces a Contextualized Representation Learning Network to enhance Human-Object Interaction (HOI) detection. It integrates affordance-guided reasoning and contextual prompts with visual cues to better capture complex interactions, addressing challenges from incomplete context modeling in existing two-stage approaches.
usefulness_reason: The paper explicitly mentions "Contextualized Representations" and "incomplete context modeling", directly aligning with the "Contextual dataset" aspect of the query. While it doesn't directly address spatio-temporal point processes or survey data, its focus on contextual information is relevant.
